intro: Chailletia bocageana, commonly known as the Bocage's chailletia, is a flowering plant native to the Cape Verde Islands. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from violet to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, oval-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stems. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is considered a rare and ornamental species.
